nodes.name: Escrow
initialize
getTokenAmount
getTokenContractAddress
getWinningBid
sellerDelivery

nodes.documentation:
@notice Transfer of buyer's winning bid (in ETH) to escrow contract
 @dev Frontend handles buyer transfer
nodes.name: buyerPayment

nodes.documentation:
@notice Check if both seller has transferred tokens and buyer has transferred winning bid (in ETH) to Escrow
 @return true if both have transferred, false if either one has not
nodes.name: bothOk

nodes.documentation:
@notice Check if seller (through Auction contract) has triggered Withdraw phase
 @return true if Withdraw phase has been triggered, false if not
nodes.name: startWithdraw

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (uint256) returns (function (bytes memory) payable returns (bool,bytes memory))

nodes.documentation:
@notice Checks if escrow is complete, if so allows Seller to withdraw winning bid (in ETH)
 @dev Performs state updates before external call to prevent reentrancy attack
nodes.name: sellerWithdraw

nodes.documentation:
@notice Checks if escrow is complete, if so allows Buyer to withdraw tokens
 @dev Performs state updates before external call to prevent reentrancy attack
nodes.name: buyerWithdraw

attributes.name: buyerWithdraw

devdoc.author: Michael S. Mueller
devdoc.details: Escrow inherits Initializable to ensure Escrow is only initialized once

bothOk().return: true if both have transferred, false if either one has not

buyerWithdraw().details: Performs state updates before external call to prevent reentrancy attack

getTokenAmount().details: Used in frontend to show token amount to both seller and buyerShould return same as getter in Auction contract, could refactor to use one getter across both contracts

getTokenContractAddress().details: Used in frontend to show contract token address to both seller and buyerShould return same as getter in Auction contract, could refactor to use one getter across both contracts
getTokenContractAddress().return: contract address of tokens being auctioned

getWinningBid().details: Used in frontend to show winning bid to both seller and buyerShould return same as getter in Auction contract, could refactor to use one getter across both contracts

initialize(address,address,uint256,addre.details: Initializable contracts have initialize function instead of constructorinitializer modifier prevents function from being called twiceSolidity casts winning bid from bytes32 to uint256 here, consider using OpenZeppelin SafeCast.sol

params._seller: address of seller triggering Auction deploy
params._tokenAmount: uint number of tokens being auctioned, assumed 18 decimal precision
params._tokenContractAddress: contract address of token being auction, assumed ERC-20
params._winningBid: 32-byte hex encoding of winning bid amount (left zero-padded on front end)

sellerDelivery().details: Frontend calls approve() of ERC-20 token before transferFrom() may be calledFrontend could have user make transfer() directly, but separation allows for earlier approve(), e.g. in Setup phase, if so desiredPerforms state updates before external call to prevent reentrancy attack

sellerWithdraw().details: Performs state updates before external call to prevent reentrancy attack

startWithdraw().return: true if Withdraw phase has been triggered, false if not

devdoc.title: Gloom - contracts to auction off ERC-20 tokens to the highest bidder (in ETH)Escrow contract, to be used in conjunction with AuctionFactory and Auction contracts

bothOk().notice: Check if both seller has transferred tokens and buyer has transferred winning bid (in ETH) to Escrow

buyerPayment().notice: Transfer of buyer's winning bid (in ETH) to escrow contract

buyerWithdraw().notice: Checks if escrow is complete, if so allows Buyer to withdraw tokens

getTokenContractAddress().notice: Get contract address of token being auctioned

initialize(address,address,uint256,addre.notice: Initialize Escrow in Auction Delivery phase with seller address, ERC-20 token amount and address, and winning bidder and bid

sellerDelivery().notice: Transfer of seller ERC-20 tokens to escrow contract

sellerWithdraw().notice: Checks if escrow is complete, if so allows Seller to withdraw winning bid (in ETH)

startWithdraw().notice: Check if seller (through Auction contract) has triggered Withdraw phase

userdoc.notice: This MVP is designed to handle one auction or one auction invite per addressThis is a demo, do not use on mainnet
